# Aufgabe

Berechnen Sie ein lineares Modell mit tidymodels und zwar anhand des `ames` Datensatzes.

Modellgleichung: `Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = ames`.

Berechnen Sie ein multiplikatives (exponenzielles) Modell.

Gesucht ist R-Quadrat als Maß für die Modellgüte im *TEST-Sample*.


*Hinweise*:

- Fixieren Sie die Zufallszahlen auf den Startwert 42.





</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_502fe0f2397babdf7e9654ea01b6e3f9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidymodels)
data(ames)
```
:::



Multiplikatives Modell:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_a1fcff984e18db2b1d0b729a5449ab24'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames <- 
  ames %>% 
  mutate(Sale_Price = log10(Sale_Price)) %>% 
  select(Sale_Price, Gr_Liv_Area)
```
:::


Nicht vergessen: AV-Transformation in beiden Samples!


Datensatz aufteilen:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_9828403bcf054b3f6aafce7534c4740a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(42)
ames_split <- initial_split(ames, prop = 0.80, strata = Sale_Price)
ames_train <- training(ames_split)
ames_test  <-  testing(ames_split)
```
:::




Modell definieren:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_f20f5535c5c4ad62b3d268e0e9034cb2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <-
  linear_reg() # engine ist "lm" im Default
```
:::




Modell fitten:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_3f1fff6e971808225b00434d7d80769e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1 <-
  m1 %>% 
  fit(Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = ames)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_8ff41bd075180ba834c2da7360e68666'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1 %>% pluck("fit") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)  Gr_Liv_Area  
  4.8552133    0.0002437  
```
:::
:::




Modellgüte im Train-Sample:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_8012b8a8ae4cb66cac484fbd7a771f4c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_performance <-
  fit1 %>% 
  extract_fit_engine()  # identisch zu pluck("fit")
```
:::




Modellgüte im Train-Sample:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_35b206d934cfcf3410de3cd9d163d142'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_performance %>% summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
stats::lm(formula = Sale_Price ~ Gr_Liv_Area, data = data)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-1.02587 -0.06577  0.01342  0.07202  0.39231 

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 4.855e+00  7.355e-03  660.12   <2e-16 ***
Gr_Liv_Area 2.437e-04  4.648e-06   52.43   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.1271 on 2928 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.4842,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.484 
F-statistic:  2749 on 1 and 2928 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::
:::



R-Quadrat via easystats:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_e8565b2806b401c69475a792fd78cb67'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(easystats)
fit1_performance %>% r2()  # rmse()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# R2 for Linear Regression
       R2: 0.484
  adj. R2: 0.484
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_8826222545e6ff36dfc328effb406f82'}

```{.r .cell-code}
tidy(fit1_performance)  # ähnlich zu parameters()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 5
  term        estimate  std.error statistic p.value
  <chr>          <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
1 (Intercept) 4.86     0.00736        660.        0
2 Gr_Liv_Area 0.000244 0.00000465      52.4       0
```
:::
:::




Vorhersagen im Test-Sample:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_cf0a00f2a5f8eddf3606a10aa768f1d6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
preds <- predict(fit1, new_data = ames_test)  # liefert TABELLE (tibble) zurück
head(preds)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 1
  .pred
  <dbl>
1  5.07
2  5.18
3  5.31
4  5.11
5  5.18
6  5.10
```
:::
:::


`preds` ist ein Tibble, also müssen wir noch die Spalte `.pred.` herausziehen, z.B. mit `pluck(preds, ".pred")`:



::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_c49e8b648d68e9b80b2d4d23ce158c5d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
preds_vec <- preds$.pred
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_ab8e9fab305b21d21d255fe067535685'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames_test2 <-
  ames_test %>% 
  mutate(preds = pluck(preds, ".pred"),  # pluck aus der Tabelle rausziehen
         .pred = preds_vec)  # oder  mit dem Dollar-Operator

head(ames_test2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 4
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area preds .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10  5.10
```
:::
:::


Oder mit `unnest`:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_e5c16ae348f56d5a9dd29d9b42ed8f84'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames_test2 <-
  ames_test %>% 
  mutate(preds = preds) %>% 
  unnest(preds) # Listenspalte "entschachteln"

head(ames_test2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 3
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10
```
:::
:::


Oder wir binden einfach die Spalte an den Tibble:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_d1191144be0b0addf57e186accc9263b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
ames_test2 <-
  ames_test %>% 
  bind_cols(preds = preds)  # nimmt Tabelle und bindet die Spalten dieser Tabelle an eine Tabelle

head(ames_test2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 3
  Sale_Price Gr_Liv_Area .pred
       <dbl>       <int> <dbl>
1       5.02         896  5.07
2       5.24        1329  5.18
3       5.60        1856  5.31
4       5.15        1056  5.11
5       5.26        1337  5.18
6       4.98         987  5.10
```
:::
:::




Modellgüte im Test-Sample:


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_f36172117b8828e445e202fba1866444'}

```{.r .cell-code}
rsq(ames_test2,
    truth = Sale_Price,
    estimate = .pred)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 × 3
  .metric .estimator .estimate
  <chr>   <chr>          <dbl>
1 rsq     standard       0.517
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_fa7a8affab4ba07920ee6db8a4a0f7e8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sol <- 0.51679
```
:::




Zur Interpretation von Log10-Werten


::: {.cell hash='tidymodels-ames-02_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_c85ba7031c67f2539043e2bde0bef572'}

```{.r .cell-code}
5e5
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 5e+05
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
5*10^5 - 500000
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0
```
:::
:::
